qas.question: What does the NSDAP stand for?
After which year did the Lord Mayor join the NSDAP?
How many Hanoverian Jews were expelled in 1938?
Who assassinated the German diplomat Eduard Ernst vom Rath?
Which city was the German diplomat in when he got assassinated?

plausible_answers.text: the Lord Mayor and the state commissioners of Hanover

qas.question: Who belong to the Nazi party prior to 1937?
What city had a large Polish population in 1937?
How many Hanoverian Jews were sent to Paris?
Who negotiated with the German diplomat?

context: After <a1_0>1937<a1_0/> <b5_0>the Lord Mayor and the state commissioners of Hanover<b5_0/> were members of the NSDAP (<a0_0>Nazi party<a0_0/>). A large Jewish population then existed in <b6_0>Hanover<b6_0/>. In October 1938, <a2_0><b7_0>484<b7_0/><a2_0/> Hanoverian Jews of Polish origin were expelled to Poland, including the Grynszpan family. However, Poland refused to accept them, leaving them stranded at the border with thousands of other Polish-Jewish deportees, fed only intermittently by the Polish Red Cross and Jewish welfare organisations. The Gryszpan's son <a3_0><b8_0>Herschel Grynszpan<b8_0/><a3_0/> was in Paris at the time. When he learned of what was happening, he drove to the German embassy in <a4_0>Paris<a4_0/> and shot the German diplomat Eduard Ernst vom Rath, who died shortly afterwards.
